welcomePage.description.message: It seems that this is the first time CardBook has been run. CardBook will attempt to collect contacts from Thunderbird’s standard address books and remote address books.

initialPage.wizard.description.message: Location for the new address book.

localPage.wizard.description.message: Type and location of the new local address book.

localPage.uri.description.message: Using the browser, choose the location for your new local address book. If you are creating a new file, specify .vcf as the file extension.

remotePage.wizard.description.message: Type and location of the new remote address book.

remotePage.description.message: What is the type of your remote address book (Caution: Google does NOT conform to vCard standards)?

remotePage.url.description.message: For a CardDAV type, enter the URL of your remote address book. You may try to use a partial URL (example : http(s)://carddav.example.org). For a Google address book, don't specify this field.

remotePage.credentials.description.message: Enter the credentials for accessing your address book. For a Google address book, the username should be your Google email.

namesPage.name.description.message: Multiple address books have been discovered. Choose which address books you want to open and their names :

findPage.name2.description.message: One remote address book found. Validate remote address book to add:

findPage.name3.description.message: Multiple remote address books found. Validate remote address books to add:

finishPage.description.message: Your new address book has been successfully configured.

finishsPage.description.message: Your new address books have been successfully configured.

autocompletionTooltip.message: Extends the standard autocompletion of contacts in address books of Thunderbird with an autocompletion of contacts in address books of CardBook.

exclusiveTooltip.message: If disabled, this option allows to retrieve contacts in Thunderbird standard address books for the yellow stars, for the email display name and the for the email autocompletion.

emailsCollectionTooltip.message: Extends the standard outgoing email address collection of Thunderbird. If enabled, email addresses not present in any CardBook address books will be added to the selected address book(s).

debugModeTooltip.message: Enable debug mode for extended logging.

statusInformationLineNumberLabel.message: Number of lines kept in the log file:

preferEmailEditionLabel.message: Double-click on a contact edits it instead of emails it

defaultRegionTooltip.message: Default region for addresses and formatting phone numbers.

editionWarn.message: When editing a contact, CardBook will display by default only those selected fields.

preferDisplayNameCheckBoxLabel.message: Always prefer display name over message header

usePreferenceValueLabel.message: Use a preference value (only for vCard 4.0)

preferenceValueLabel.message: Label of the PREF value field

IMPPGroupboxWarn.message: This setup allows Internet communications using the intended protocol.

preferIMPPPrefWarn.message: If no address is marked, a connection is proposed for all of the contact's addresses.

URLPhoneGroupboxWarn.message: This section applies if you have selected the url protocol for phone. The URL should contain {{1}}, referring to the phone number.

encryptionExplanation.message: CardBook may encrypt your local data. For this purpose, it will use a secret key stored in the Password Manager. If you loose this key, the recovery of your local data is impossible. For a complete protection, activating the Thunderbird master password feature is recommended.

orgWarn.message: The field ORG may contain a structured text value consisting of components separated by the SEMICOLON character (for example : yourcompany;yourservice;yourdepartment). The fields below describe the component labels of this structure.

listPanelLabel.message: If your server does not support categories (like Google, Apple, Zimbra, etc…), lists are a good way to send emails to groups. vCard 3.0 does not natively support lists, but this may be achieved with custom fields, so if you want to use lists in vCard 3.0, you have to define these fields.

syncWarn.message: Synchronizing propagates your modifications to a remote server and the server's modifications to you.

solveConflictsLabel.message: If a contact was updated both on server and locally:

maxModifsPushedLabel.message: Maximum number of modifications pushed per synchronization:

multigetLabel.message: For GET requests, group contacts by:

discoveryWarn.message: At every synchronization, a check on the URLs below will be run to search for any new or deleted address books.

preferEmailPrefWarn.message: If no address is marked, the message is sent to all of the contact's addresses.

warnEmptyEmailsLabel.message: Warn me when I attempt to email contacts without an email address

useOnlyEmailLabel.message: Only use email addresses, without their Display Names

attachVCardWarn.message: To automatically add a vCard to your emails, select a vCard for each email account. If activated, CardBook will attach this vCard to every outgoing email from this account.

birthdayListWarn.message: Anniversaries are only searched within CardBook address books.

numberOfDaysForSearchingLabel.message: Number of days to check anniversaries for:

showPopupEvenIfNoBirthdayLabel.message: Show popup window when anniversaries list is empty

remindViaLightningGroupboxLabel.message: Remind via Thunderbird Lightning Calendar Extension

numberOfDaysForWritingLabel.message: Number of days to write anniversaries:

calendarEntryTitleTooltip.message: Template title for the calendar event. It should contain two placeholders %S, respectively replaced by name and age. If the field is empty, a standard message is used.

calendarEntryWholeDayLabel.message: Calendar event for the whole day

calendarEntryAlarmLabel.message: Alarm(s) to n hours for calendar events (Example: 4,+1):

calendarEntryAlarmTooltip.message: Enter how many hours before the anniversary Lightning's alarm should remind you. If the field is empty, there would be no alarm. If you want multiple alarms, enter the alarms in a comma-separated list.

calendarEntryCategoriesTooltip.message: One or more categories, comma-separated. If the field is empty, there would be no category.

enableAccountsTooltip.message: Enable or disable search and synchronization of address books.

colorAccountsTooltip.message: Color address books search results (use when searches span multiple address books).

readonlyAccountsTooltip.message: Set address books in read-only or read-write mode.

searchRemoteLabel.message: This address book shows contacts only after a search

findDuplicatesFromAccountsOrCatsLabel.message: Find Duplicate Contacts in Current Address Book

adrFormulaExplanation.message: It is possible to customize the way CardBook formats its addresses. This formula consists in blocks enclosed by “()”. In these blocks there might be many parts delimited by “|”.

fnFormulaExplanation.message: It is possible to customize the way CardBook generates its Display Name. This formula consists in blocks enclosed by “()”. In these blocks there might be many parts delimited by “|”.

formulaExplanation1.message: ({{1}}|{{2}}) : If {{1}} is empty, then the block will be replaced by {{2}}.

formulaExplanation2.message: ({{1}}|{{2}}|{{3}}) : If {{1}} equals {{2}}, then the block will be replaced by {{3}}.

formulaExplanation3.message: ({{1}}|{{2}}|{{3}}|{{4}}) : If {{1}} equals {{2}}, then the block will be replaced by {{3}}, else by {{4}}.

formulaExplanation4.message: ({{1}}|*|{{2}}|{{3}}|{{4}}) : If {{1}} includes {{2}}, then the block will be replaced by {{3}}, else by {{4}}.

formulaExplanation5.message: ({{1}}|^|{{2}}|{{3}}|{{4}}) : If {{1}} starts with {{2}}, then the block will be replaced by {{3}}, else by {{4}}.

formulaExplanation6.message: ({{1}}|$|{{2}}|{{3}}|{{4}}) : If {{1}} ends with {{2}}, then the block will be replaced by {{3}}, else by {{4}}.

cardbookSwitchButtonTooltip.message: Switch family name and given name

convertVCardsTooltip.message: The vCard version of some contacts is different from the vCard version of your address book, this button may convert these vCards

mergeInstructionsLabel.message: Select the fields you want to keep for the new contact
